Semantic Web Technologies

This section provides an overview of semantic web domain. In fact it reports all relevant information regarding W3C specification and main technologies which can be used to satisfy requirements.

W3C specification

Resource Description
RDF Resource Description Framework. Basic language which is possible to state a set of information about some resources with.
RDF Schema Language, based on RDF, which can model a relationships between classes, and properties: extension, domain and range.
OWL Web Ontology Language. A powerful language which extends RDFSchema providing more expressive power. The full specification is not decidable in general, that's why a number of profiles or subsets, that give up some expressive power in exchange for more attractive and feasible computational characteristics, has been defined.
SPARQL SPARQL is the standard query language over a RDF Store, meant to retrieve data according to specific requests without modifications. In order to provide write features SPARQL Update has been defined. Its syntax and principles recalls SQL.

All information reported in this subsection has been taken from:

  • W3C specification (see http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-primer/ and related documents)
  • Semantic Web Programming - J. Hebler, M. Fisher, R. Blace, A. Perez-Lopez - Wiley Publishing Inc.

N.B.: A new SPARQL working draft has been submitted (v. 1.1). After February, 6 2012 this version may become the recommended one!

Technologies

Resource Description
Jena Jena is a Java framework for building Semantic Web applications, which provides a collection of tools and Java libraries designed to help semantic web and linked-data apps development.
Pellet Pellet is an OWL 2 reasoner, so provides reasoning services for OWL ontologies for all ontology-based data management applications.
